page.title: 06Breeds of sheep
page.content: The main anilmals kept on farms are sheep, cows and beef cattle. The breeds of sheep most common are Swaledales, which have black faces with speckled grey noses and legs, and live most of their lives on the open moors but most of the ewes are brought into enclosed land for a few weeks during the spring for lambing. The second most popular breeds are Suffolk and Scotch. Suffolk sheep have short tight wool and black faces and are kept on the enclosed farms. Scotch sheep have black and white faces and long woollen coats. Also popular with farmers wives are Jacob sheep which provide a good fleece for spinning and make hard wearing garments for the working family.
